$50,000.00/yr - $65,000.00/yr
Working at LyssnLyssn.io, Inc. (Lyssn) is a technology start-up focused on using Artificial Intelligence (AI) to improve the quality of behavioral healthcare and human services. Lyssn is headquartered in Seattle, Washington; however, the majority of our team members work remotely.We started Lyssn with a single conviction: Health and well-being is a basic human right, and people who are suffering should have access to the best quality care. Our vision is to design technology that maximizes therapists, counselors, coaches, and caseworkers’ ability to help their clients and patients, and we offer a suite of technologies to scaffold and enhance training, supervision, and quality assurance to do just that!Our company spans a diverse range of skills and disciplines including natural language processing, machine learning, psychotherapy research, clinical assessment and behavioral coding, project management, software development, UI design, community-based research, and small business development.Inclusion is our mission Our products train providers in acceptance and appreciation of differences. To create products like this that serve everyone, we need to include everyone. Therefore, we hire great people from a wide variety of backgrounds, not just because it’s the right thing to do, but because it makes our company stronger. If you share our values and our enthusiasm for supporting behavioral healthcare and human services, we welcome you to join our team at Lyssn.Research Project Coordinator - Full Time - RemoteLyssn is actively engaged in research and development activities, funded by multiple grants and contracts from NIMH, NIDA, NIAAA, the Annie E. Casey Foundation, the John Templeton Foundation, and other private entities. The Research Project Coordinator (PC) will work closely with the Research Project Manager, and principal investigator’s of grants, and projects. They will assist the Project Manager in day-to-day oversight of key tasks and timelines, including compliance with protocols, IRB submissions, budget, regulatory agencies and coordination with research and clinical partners, recruitment, and data collection.All projects focus on AI-based technology development to support training, supervision, and quality assurance of evidence-based behavioral healthcare and human services (e.g., counseling, psychotherapy, and caseworkers). The PC will have project management responsibilities on one or more of the following projects: 1) Development of Web-based training platform for a variety of different treatments; 2) Development and assessment of a chatbot to train basic counseling skills in Motivational Interviewing; and 3) Implementation and evaluation of automated, AI-based feedback for supervision and quality assurance of Cognitive Behavioral Therapy in community clinics.The ideal PC will bring with them a background of work in clinical psychology or social work and is passionate about improving behavioral health care in a start-up environment. This individual should also thrive working remotely and can demonstrate a history of strong project management skills in organization, planning, risk management, critical thinking, and effective communication and interpersonal skills.Job Type / ScheduleFull-time employee, 40 hours per week, remote. Participation in three-day, quarterly in-person retreats at a range of locations around the country (e.g., California, Arizona, Utah, New York, Seattle) may be required for this position. Employees will be required to be vaccinated against COVID-19 to attend in-person meetings.SupervisionThis position is available primarily under the direction of Roisín Slevin, Research Project Manager. All Lyssn employees may interact with this position at different time points via an online interactive platform. A non-disclosure agreement will be required in this position.Essential FunctionsProvide professional project management for new and existing grants, contracts, and development projectsEnsure that projects are delivered on-time, within scope, and within budgetAssist in the definition of project scope and objectives, involving all relevant stakeholders and ensuring technical feasibilityEnsure resource availability and allocationCo-develop a detailed project plan to monitor and track progress for new projects and adhere to plans developed for existing projectsManage changes to the project scope, project schedule and project costs using appropriate verification techniquesManage the relationship and communication between internal and external stakeholders; proactively contact and ensure all parties are on trackCreate and maintain comprehensive project documentationTrack project performance, specifically to analyze the successful completion of short and long-term goalsMeasure project performance using appropriate tools and techniquesPerform other related duties as assignedRequirementsRequired Qualifications3+ years in research coordination and/or project managementHighly effective communicator with exceptional interpersonal and social skills; ability to relate to people of diverse backgrounds and adapt communication style to specific audiencesEffective verbal, written, and presentation communication skills (platforms include but not limited to email, social media, and chat)Proven reliability and flexibility to work independentlyHighly organized, collaborative, and detail-orientedDesired Skills And QualificationsExceptional multi-task task management skills across a varied set of responsibilitiesProven track record of proactively driving projects with minimal supervisionExperience working within research regulatory structures, including Institutional Review Boards (IRB’s)Benefits InsuranceMedical (Premera Blue Cross)Dental (Delta Dental)Vision (VSP Vision Care)Life/AD&D (Unum)Excepted Benefit Health Reimbursement Arrangement (EBHRA)Employee assistance program401(k) retirement planPaid Leave: vacation, sick, holiday, parental, bereavement, jury dutyCorporate matching charitable giving programInternet stipendHome office stipendAdditional benefits may be discussed during the hiring processSalary RangeThe salary range is $50,000-$65,000 and will be based on experience in the field. Additional compensation, such as equity, will be discussed during the hiring process.Equal Opportunity Lyssn is committed to creating a diverse environment. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. We are committed to fair employment practices regarding citizenship.
